page.title: 14A Visit to Lathkill Dale
page.content: When we went to Lathkill Dale, we went for a walk along the dale by the river. We saw a dabchick and ducks and a moorhen. At the edge of the Lathkill we were looking across the river at something else, and all of a sudden my teacher saw a water vole lying in the water as still as could be, and then it suddenly darted away from us. I saw some rabbits on the hillside. There were some weeds called broad- leafed pond weed, which were a lovely green. There were some water beetles and fresh-water shrimps. They were wriggling around in the river. We caught some and brought them back to school. There were lots of waterfalls, 12 in all, and all of them were man- made. People made them because fishing became popular. In the middle of the water falls there was a pool where the trout swam.
